ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned that writing long essays is very hard!
Through the senior essay, I was able to develop a research question of my own, complete fieldwork, and write extensively on a particular topic.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Not much structure. Could benefit from more collaboration and engagement with the anthro community at Yale.
Wish there was a way to share works in progress w/ other senior Anthro majors and discuss

Both a strength and weakness is the level of independence afforded through the senior thesis. I wished I had been given more information regarding what it would be like earlier in my undergraduate career (perhaps summer before junior year) so that I could plan on taking more classes (such as one on fieldwork) before embarking on the thesis.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's your thesis. Take the class.
